articles.headline: Trump Institute Offered Get-Rich Schemes With Plagiarized Lessons
articles.snippet: The institute, to which Donald J. Trump lent his name in 2005, was owned by a couple accused of fraud, and its educational materials had been lifted from an old real estate manual.
articles.abstract: The institute, to which Donald J. Trump lent his name in 2005, was owned by a couple accused of fraud, and its educational materials had been lifted from an old real estate manual.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2005, as he was making a transition from developing real estate to capitalizing on his fame through ventures like a reality show and product-licensing deals, Donald J. Trump hit upon a two-pronged strategy for entering the field of for-profit education.

articles.headline: Puerto Rico Relief Measure Clears Senate, Goes to Obama
articles.snippet: The Senate voted for a House bill, backed by the Obama administration, to create a control board and help the island restructure its $72 billion debt.
articles.abstract: The Senate voted for a House bill, backed by the Obama administration, to create a control board and help the island restructure its $72 billion debt.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Just two days before Puerto Rico plans to default on a large debt payment, the Senate on Wednesday passed and sent to the White House a relief measure to help the financially desperate island surmount its fiscal crisis, ending a grueling, monthslong effort to rescue the commonwealth.

articles.headline: How China Took Center Stage in Bitcoin’s Civil War
articles.snippet: Through vast server farms and canny investments, Chinese companies have effectively centralized control over a currency designed to be borderless.
articles.abstract: Through vast server farms and canny investments, Chinese companies have effectively centralized control over a currency designed to be borderless.
articles.lead_paragraph: A delegation of American executives flew to Beijing in April for a secret meeting just blocks from Tiananmen Square. They had come to court the new kingmakers in one of the strangest experiments in money the world has seen: the virtual currency known as Bitcoin.

articles.headline: Film Academy Broadens Voting Pool After Oscars Criticism
articles.snippet: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences more than doubled the number of invitations to make good on a promise to increase female and minority membership.
articles.abstract: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences more than doubled the number of invitations to make good on a promise to increase female and minority membership.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences invited many more minorities and women to join on Wednesday as the first major step in reshaping its membership after the #OscarsSoWhite controversy this year.

articles.headline: Nearly All U.S. Banks Pass Fed’s Stress Test
articles.snippet: Only Morgan Stanley did not pass unconditionally, and the American subsidiaries of Deutsche Bank and Santander failed outright.
articles.abstract: Only Morgan Stanley did not pass unconditionally, and the American subsidiaries of Deutsche Bank and Santander failed outright.
articles.lead_paragraph: All but one of the nation’s largest banks earned an unconditional passing grade from federal regulators on their annual stress tests, which measure their preparedness to weather a financial crisis.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Michael Corkery

articles.headline: The E.U. Is Democratic. It Just Doesn’t Feel That Way.
articles.snippet: The bloc was designed to rise above and defuse nationalist politics. That is why, for many Europeans, it does not feel like a functioning democracy.
articles.abstract: The bloc was designed to rise above and defuse nationalist politics. That is why, for many Europeans, it does not feel like a functioning democracy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Does the European Union have a democracy deficit?

articles.headline: Turkey, a Conduit for Fighters Joining ISIS, Begins to Feel Its Wrath
articles.snippet: For years, Turkey served as a rear base, transit hub and shopping bazaar for the Islamic State, but now, officials say Tuesday’s attack bore ISIS hallmarks.
articles.abstract: For years, Turkey served as a rear base, transit hub and shopping bazaar for the Islamic State, but now, officials say Tuesday’s attack bore ISIS hallmarks.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — When the bodies of Islamic State fighters are recovered on the Syrian battlefield, the passports found on them have often been stamped in Turkey, which thousands of recruits pass through on their way to join the terror group.

articles.headline: A Slow, Steady Siege on an ISIS Stronghold in Libya
articles.snippet: With a willing commander, a Times correspondent and photographer set off down a highway strewn with the charred remains of vehicles destroyed in suicide bombings.
articles.abstract: With a willing commander, a Times correspondent and photographer set off down a highway strewn with the charred remains of vehicles destroyed in suicide bombings.
articles.lead_paragraph: SURT, Libya — Perched on a doorstep, the teenage Juma brothers whiled away the afternoon with a lazy game of checkers, pushing pebbles around a board chalked in the dust, seemingly oblivious to the crackle of gunfire and boom of artillery a few miles away.

articles.headline: Refugees Encounter a Foreign Word: Welcome
articles.snippet: How Canadian hockey moms, poker buddies and neighbors are adopting Syrians, a family at a time.
articles.abstract: How Canadian hockey moms, poker buddies and neighbors are adopting Syrians, a family at a time.
articles.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — One frigid day in February, Kerry McLorg drove to an airport hotel here to pick up a family of Syrian refugees. She was cautious by nature, with a job poring over insurance data, but she had never even spoken to the people who were about to move into her basement.
articles.byline: By Jodi Kantor and Catrin Einhorn

articles.headline: Boris Johnson Won’t Seek to Lead Britain, but Michael Gove Will
articles.snippet: Mr. Johnson’s decision not to seek leadership of the Conservative Party came after Mr. Gove, a onetime ally, entered the contest.
articles.abstract: Mr. Johnson’s decision not to seek leadership of the Conservative Party came after Mr. Gove, a onetime ally, entered the contest.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — In a day of intrigue and betrayal, predictions about the next prime minister of Britain were overturned on Thursday as the presumed favorite, Boris Johnson, said he would not run after his ally in the Brexit campaign, Michael Gove, suddenly announced his candidacy.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Stephen Castle

articles.headline: Chris Christie Becomes Powerful Figure in Donald Trump Campaign
articles.snippet: Despite taunts from both sides of the aisle, the governor has emerged as the candidate’s right-hand man — and as a potential running mate.
articles.abstract: Despite taunts from both sides of the aisle, the governor has emerged as the candidate’s right-hand man — and as a potential running mate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Defeated by Donald J. Trump in the 2016 primaries and derided by fellow Republicans for his subsequent embrace of Mr. Trump, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey has quietly emerged as one of the most influential advisers to his party’s presumptive presidential nominee and one of the leading contenders to be his running mate.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Maggie Haberman
